title: Monitoring mobility through innovation: the example of the city of Ljubljana in CIVITAS
segmentation: Thank you very much.
So just a brief clarification.
The beginning was that have international relations and protocols to do with transporting cities alot.
If you want to use.
The experiences of other cities also in your city.
If you need to coordinate things, especially also between stakeholders in your city, you develop skills you get used to work together.
So this is just to give you an impression of what.
What is my role in this in this project anyhow?
What is the Civitas oops?
Sorry.
What is the Civitas family?
I believe many of you already know it.
It is an initiative of the European Union.
Linked started its started link to the FP5, continued with FP 6 and now continues with Civitas Plus in FP7.
You see that quite many of cities are on this map because it is an initiative which is dedicated to cities to improve the urban transport.
Windows in those cities, but also to gather experience that can be used in other cities as best as best example.
Anyhow, do Brianna.

I don't know how much time and possibility to you had to explore our city, but it is a city with a population of 276 permanent inhabitants, with many more coming every day to the city to either to work or to study.
We teach the city where nearly 20% of our inhabitants are University students, and as mentioned, we have about 130,000 commuters per day.
Journeys of commuters per day.
One of the features of our city is that it is a five star configuration, which of course has an impact.
Also on our transport needs in the city.
In relation to what we have heard in the plenary.
Specially the link between transport and climate change, Ljubljana has set itself a very ambitious goal.
We think to diminish the greenhouse emissions for 8% by 2012 compared to 86.

This is the starting date for many of us, but also as you see the two pictures speaking from themselves come from a situation which is still present in our city today to a much better solution when transport and.
Especially mobility is concerned.
We have set ourselves.
Quite ambitious aims as far as the public transport is concerned.
As far as alternatives modes are concerned and also about fried delivery is concerned.
And also we would like to have less transit through or around our city because that is something that damages a lot the quality of our life.
Therefore, as Marcel has already mentioned, we joined the Civitas initiative.
Firstly, in the Civitas to call.
But at that time that was in in 2004 as a learning city, with only smaller and less ambitious goals and aims and measures to be adopted in the field of alternative fuels and cycling.
Now we have set ourselves.
Um and manage to.
Develop a much more ambitious plan, that one in Civitas 3.
A call that has been published in 2006 and Ljubljana in this call has become a leader city and the coordinator of a project of five cities of that is Ghent.
Participating in our project, Zagreb Brno End portal so.
The very important feature of the this project is that it is as I said, it is a research project, but it is also demonstration.
Research is really closely linked to the implementation of different measures, which we've set as far as the plan is concerned.
We will concentrate them on a particular corridor that goes throughout the whole center of the city.
What do we want to achieve by this project?
We really want to put strong stress and the achieve big change in our public transport.
We want it especially to be fast because this is the main reason why it is not competitive with individual cars.
Today's we want of course by using many tools which we have seen were used in other cities also.
Have a.
Or reach an impact on the way people think and act that is on their behavior.
And of course we'd really want to link and create synergies with all the different initiatives and projects.
Ideas that are present already in our city to give you an idea about the measures we want to implement just a few, a few highlights.
Of course it's not a complete list of the measures we want to implement implement, but we really believe that some of them.
Will make a big difference in Ljubljana and I hope that if there is Bill will be until R 2013 in Ljubljana.
You will be all able to see the difference.
Of course we're working on 2.
So to say in two on two aspects, one is the fuels and use of alternative fuels in the city and the other one is the management and changing behavior.
Our aim this is our success once per year for about 2 hours when we have the bachelors from high schools having a parade and dancing on our Main Street.
But this is something we use as an illustration of really the.
How to say will team at aim?
Maybe it still is exaggerating, but it is a name of changing the mobility culture, changing it on both sides.
When the providers and I mean specially local and also regional and international authorities are concerned to provide the conditions too.

Make changes, change the way people move when they need, but also to change the attitudes and the behavior of everyone of us because there were many roundtables in Ljubljana also on the topic of Green Paper and on mobility in the city and so on.
But I always heard a lot of things and demands intended to the local and national authorities, and I very seldom fear here.
What everyone is really prepared to do to change.
Also it's her or her on behavior.
And as I've heard.
And I believe that research has an important role to play.

It has it certainly also in our project and what we really hope is that after a situation where we had a lot of research studies, analysis that were left somewhere in drawers and never put into life, we come to a big amount of research which will deal with other with evaluation of what we have done.
Therefore, it will be important because it will mean that we have made changes, but it will also be important because it will help us to do things even better.
Thank you.
